issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Description:

Clicking on 'Set Tab 0 Active' button does not set all tabbed bars index to 0.
There seems a problem in the tabbedbar.js code. Title control and custom tabbed bar are having same name. So the index is getting set for the custom tabbed bar only.

STEPS TO REPRODUCE:-
1. Install the KitchenSink on iPhone 6/6+ simulator.
2. Navigate to: Controls => Tabbed Bar 
3. Press each button.
4. Press "Set Tab 0 Active" 

EXPECTED RESULT:
3. All indexes should be nulled

ACTUAL RESULT:
3. All tabbed bar except Title control tabbed bar index not setting to null.
fields.summary: iOS8: KitchenSink control Tabbed Bar 'Set Tab 0 Active'  button failing to set null index for one of the Tabbed bar.
fields.environment:
Tested on: 
1. Mac OSX 10.9.4 
2. Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.4.0.201409261245
3. Titanium SDK, build: 3.4.0.v20140925164115
4. Titanium CLI, build: 3.4.0-rc4
5. Alloy: 1.5.0-rc5
6. Xcode 6.0.1
7. iOS SDK 8.0
8. Titanium Code Processor version 1.1.1

comments.body: Resolving ticket as Invalid as there is now a new version of Kitchen Sink available and we no longer support the version which relates to this ticket.
